Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.procedure

Interface Context

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicContext
    public interface Context
    The context in which a procedure is invoked. This is a read-only structure. For instance, a read-only transactional procedure might have access to the current statement it is being invoked in through this. The context is entirely defined by the caller of the procedure, so what is available in the context depends on the context of the call.

      • valueMapper

        ValueMapper<Object> valueMapper()
        Returns the value mapper of this context.

        This method is always safe to call, there should always be a value mapper associated with the context.

        Returns:
        the value mapper of this context

      • internalTransaction

        InternalTransaction internalTransaction()
                                 throws ProcedureException
        Returns the internal transaction of this context

        If no transaction has been associated with this context this method will throw a ProcedureException

        Returns:
        the internal transaction of this context
        Throws:
        ProcedureException - if no transaction has been associated with the context

      • internalTransactionOrNull

        InternalTransaction internalTransactionOrNull()
        Returns:
        The internal transaction of this context or null if no transaction has been associated with the context.
